Muzaffarnagar: Two die, six injured afte.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Two persons were killed and six others, including two children, critically injured after a speeding car rammed into a bike on Meerapur road in Muzaffarnagar’s Khatauli. The two persons on the bike, Yogesh (40) and Rajender (60), died on the spot. The six persons in the car continue to be in a critical condition as the car crashed into a nearby tree. The deceased were residents of Behsuma of Meerut. The incident took place in the afternoon on Meerapur road, an accident-prone stretch, when the car’s driver lost control over the steering, ramming into a bike and then hitting a tree. A passer-by dialed 100 and a police team from Khatauli area, along with an ambulance, rushed to the spot. All the victims were shifted to a hospital, where Yogesh and Rajender were declared brought dead. According to station house officer (SHO) of Khatauli police station Har Sharan Sharma, “The bodies have been sent for autopsy, while the injured have been referred to a higher center in Meerut. An investigation is underway.” It should be noted that Khatuli has the reputation of being an accident-prone area. In May, three people died and two others were injured after a UP roadways bus rammed into a car in Muzaffarnagar’s Khatauli area. In March, a major accident claimed several lives in Khatauli. While five people had died, three were injured after an SUV rammed into a dumper truck, which had been wrongly parked on the roadside. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CCSU to cut down 507 trees for new build.description: MEERUT: Chaudhary Charan Singh (CCS) University administration is all set to cut 507 trees to make way for new buildings for the expansion of various departments on its campus. According to university officials, 507 standing and 356 fallen trees have already been auctioned, and the process of felling standing tress will begin soon. The move has, however, irked locals to whom the university campus serves as a prime destination for morning walk with its immaculate green cover. The university administration, however, claimed that the decision to cut tress was taken after receiving permission from the forest department, and they would plant twice the number of tress than they had fallen. CCSU vice-chancellor NK Taneja said, “The construction of several buildings, including a separate building for evaluation department and expansion of the infrastructure for the existing department of management and other courses, are in the pipeline.” “We will plant more than double than we are felling so that the ecosystem on the campus is not affected,” said Taneja. According to university sources, the auction took place on June 11, and Rs 15.51 lakh came from selling the trees. The process of felling trees and clearing land will begin soon, they confirmed. Vivek Kochar, lawyer and resident of Shastri Nagar area, said, “I have been going for a morning walk on the university campus for the past 25 years. I am really disappointed to learn about the university’s decision. After cantonment, the university campus is the only place with optimum greenery and it should not be destroyed.” The university administration, however, claimed that most of the standing trees (mostly eucalyptus) that they were felling had dried up and could fall abruptly during storm. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man kidnaps eight-month-old nephew as pa.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Local police have rescued an eight-month-old toddler and arrested his uncle and his accomplice for kidnapping. According to police, the baby, Avi, went missing from his house in Colony Niyajupura, where is mother, Mamta, is staying with her parents. Avi was sleeping while his mother was busy with household chores on Saturday afternoon. His parents approached City police station and filed a complaint about the missing baby. Superintendent of police Sudhir Kumar formed three police teams to find the baby. According to police sources, a search was launched across the district but to no avail. During investigation, police found that Mamta's brother, Sachin, appeared to be panic-stricken and was trying to divert police attention toward a street vendor. Police decided to question him. During sustained questioning, Sachin broke down and confessed to having kidnapped his nephew for the sake of his married girlfriend Sachin said handed over the baby to his paramour who already has three daughters but desperate to have a son. Late on Saturday night, police rescued Avi from Sachin’s girlfriend’s house and handed him over to his parents. According to deputy superintendent of police, city, Harish Bhadauria, “Sachin and an associate kidnapped the baby. A case under IPC section 393 (kidnaping) has been registered against accused.Further investigation is on.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP DGP: We are determined to provide jus.description: MEERUT: Uttar Pradesh director general of police (DGP) OP Singh on Monday said justice will be provided to Shamli-based journalist Amit Sharma, who was assaulted by GRP station officer Rakesh Kumar and his aides on the intervening night of June 11-12. "We have suspended the police officer and we are after him. We are determined to provide justice to the journalist but everything will be done according to the law. We have in the past terminated services more than a dozen police officers found guilty of abusing their position," said the DGP in Baghpat, where he had come to inaugurate a new fire station in Khekra region of the district. Singh was reacting to a query pertaining to the recent assault on the journalist. "This may be an isolated incident, but let me tell you that, according to a study conducted by the department, there is a 40% increase in 'behavioral positivity' within the department's personnel and we are doing everything to increase the percentage," said DGP Singh. On continuation of police encounters despite UP police drawing heavy criticism, Singh said, "Let me be very particular about one thing, encounter is not a state policy and we always try to arrest a criminal first but police force retaliates only if attacked first. We always follow rules, be it in accordance with the NHRC guidelines or magisterial inquiry, everything is done by the book. There have been cases where NHRC has found our work satisfactory, so have the courts as well." DGP Singh, however, echoed chief minister Yogi Adityanath's concern on women's safety in the state, "As our CM has also showed concern on this aspect, it is a special concern for us as well, especially after some unfortunate incidents such as the one in Aligarh. We have to work a lot in this direction and we are already progressing fast in this regard. For instance, we have put a set of two zones each under senior lady police officers who analyze crime against women and take action accordingly. We are determined to ensure a fear-free environment in the state." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sisters, 15 & 20, abducted, one of them.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Three youths allegedly abducted two sisters, one of them minor, in Shamli and took them to a field where the elder one was raped. At the time of the abduction, the two girls aged 15 and 20 were alone in the house and when they did not return after a long time, their relatives began to look for them. An FIR has been filed against three youths. According to police sources, the elder sister was raped by a man while the other two accused were involved in the girls’ abduction and harassing the minor. The crime occurred in Issopur Tila village under the jurisdiction of Kandhla police station of Shamli district on Tuesday. According to police, Nitin and Vishal and one of their associates forcibly took both the sisters to a field where one girl was raped by an accused while the other two harassed the minor. After the incident, all the accused fled the spot, but later police managed to arrest two of them, who were sent to jail. A case has been registered under sections 376 (rape) and 363 (kidnaping) of IPC and other sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. Kandhla station house officer Sanjeev Vishnoi said, “We have sent the survivors to the district hospital for medical examination. Their statements will be recorded before a magistrate soon. Two accused have been arrested and the third will be nabbed too.” In a similar incident in Muzaffarnagar district on June 12, three men had allegedly harassed two sisters when they were in a farm with their mother in Kaserwa village of the district. Police have booked all the three men under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and have arrested two of men. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

After crackdown, Meerut\u2019s dairy own.description: MEERUT: Fearing administrative crackdown, as many as 200 buffaloes were sold to slaughterhouses at throwaway prices in the past 24 hours, said Parvez Tyagi, a general secretary of Meerut Dairy Association. “Dairy owners, especially the small owners, who cannot make immediate arrangements to relocate, are being forced to sell their cattle at throwaway prices,” added Pravesh Tyagi. Amid the ongoing tussle between Meerut administration and local dairy owners, a delegation of dairy owners met senior BJP leader Laxmikant Bajpai on Saturday and apprised him of the situation. The BJP leader met ADM (city) Mahesh Chandra, additional municipal commissioner Amit Kumar and SP (city) Akhilesh Narayan Singh with a list of demands of dairy owners. Among their primary demand, the dairy association wants a cattle colony, on the lines of one coming up in Varanasi, be set up where these dairies can be rehabilitated. Bajpai assured them to take up the matter with local police and administrative officials in the district. Notably, on the Allahabad High Court’s directive, all 2,200 dairies in the district are to be moved out of the city limits as they were functioning illegally. The dairy owners had earlier said that they would remove the cattle on their own, but it was not done. The local administration has now started the drive against the dairies which are to be shifted by June 30. Talking to TOI, additional municipal commissioner Amit Kumar said, “Most of these dairies are unauthorized and there is a standing order to move them out. Their demand of rehabilitating them to a cattle colony is out of our jurisdiction.” The district administration, over constant pressure from dairy owners, is trying to rope in Meerut Development Authority for construction of a cattle colony to rehabilitate the small dairy owners. “The high court order has no binding directions to provide provision for cattle colony but we are trying our best to accommodate their demand,” said another senior official. Three kids injured in Muzaffarnagar blaz.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Three children were seriously injured when they were playing after a cot they were sitting on caught fire in Purbaliyan in Mansoorpur area of the Muzaffarnagar on Tuesday night. The children Abdul (9), Fiza (6) and Arshad (8) received severe burn injuries. While Abdul and Arshad are being treated at a hospital here, Fiza has been referred to Delhi. They had come from Delhi to attend a wedding here. They were playing on the cot when the incident happened. The fire later spread to electric wires that were kept beside the cot. Deputy superintendent of police, Khatauli, Ashish Partap Singh, “The children have been sent for treatment. A further investigation is on in the matter.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

RSS leader at Darul Uloom with message o.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Senior RSS functionary Indresh Kumar visited renowned Islamic seminary Darul Uloom at Deoband with message of brotherhood and mututal love on Thursday. While Kumar, who also heads Sangh's Muslim Rashtriya Manch, called it 'courtesy visit', the seminary said that its doors were open for everyone. Kumar was in Deoband for a manch's function after which he went to Darul Uloom, where he was welcomed by seminary VC Maulana Abul Qasim Nomani. During the visit, Nomani apprised Kumar of the history of Ulema's role in freedom struggle. "Our doors are always open for visitors. We welcomed Indreshji with an open heart," he said. "We have come here with the message of mutual love and brotherhood and that's the only way the country can move forward on the path to prosperity. The government should devise methods to upgrade education and increase job opportunities for everyone," said the Sangh leader. Without naming anyone, Kumar said: "There are a few opportunist leaders who try to create a rift between two communities and also create a sense of fear among minorities for personal gains. But we are of the view that all must follow their respect religions and respect others' faiths." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In personal letter to sarpanchs, PM urge.description: BIJNOR: Expressing concern over drinking water shortage, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has written a letter to all the sarpanchs (gram sabha heads) across the country, urging them to conserve water and make it a mass movement. The letter comes in the backdrop of many rural states, including Uttar Pradesh, facing acute shortage of water for drinking and farming purposes. In his letter, he said, “The rainy season is about to set in. We are fortunate that god has given sufficient rain to our country. It is our duty to respect the gift of god. Therefore, we should make all provision to conserve rain water as much as possible. We should see that agriculture water is used for farming purposes, while making separate provision for drinking water in the village. We should construct solid boundaries around agriculture fields, construct new ponds, revive rivers and lakes. Besides, we should keep them clean. We must use water judiciously.” Modi instructed all the district magistrates to read out the letter to each and every village so that his message is conveyed to everyone. He further appealed them to make the water conservation program a mass revolution on the lines of the ‘Swachhta’ campaign. Responding to the letter, district in-charge Nand Kishore said, “We have received the letter written by PM Modi. We will strive to take the PM’s vision forward.” According to officials, a big chunk of UP comes under the plains of Ganges and Yamuna rivers, which is one of the world’s wealthy groundwater reserves. But over the years, reliance on groundwater resources has highly increased. Especially, due to unplanned and uncontrolled exploitation for irrigation, drinking water, industrial areas and due to lack of integrated and effective management and planning. According to UP’s ground water department, there are 820 development blocks in the state, out of which 113 are overexploited, 59 are critical, 45 are semi critical, and 603 are stated to be safe. Assessment of increase in dependence of ground water resources can be gauged from the fact that in 2000, water development exploitation rate was 54.31 % and in 2009 it was estimated at 72.16 % which has now increased to 73.65 % in 2011 and 73.78% in 2013. Alert locals foil Rs 24 lakh loot bid in.description: MEERUT: Alert locals foiled loot bid in Saharanpur's Gangoh area on Monday morning after two assailants tried to flee with Rs 24 lakh in cash that they looted from a bank staffer. Several onlookers chased and eventually cornered one of the assailants Vishal while two of his aides managed to escape. The cash was recovered and the nabbed assailant was handed over to police while combing operation to apprehend the other has begun. "The incident happened on Monday morning when Amit Verma, cashier at district cooperative bank along with his colleague Ajay Kumar were returning to their branch after collecting Rs 24 lakh in cash from the main branch in Gangoh,” police said. The assailants attacked the duo and snatched the bag. As the accused tried to escape, commuters present at the spot immediately responded to the alarm raised by victim. Later police was alerted and the nabbed accused was handed over to police. He was identified as Vishal, resident of Bilaspur area in Gangoh. The two suspects, who have managed to flee include Kalyan, uncle of Vishal and Ayush Kumar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Hundreds bid farewell to Major killed in.description: MEERUT: Emotions ran high in the city as politicians and administrative officials made a beeline for late Major Ketan Sharma’s home. His body arrived on Tuesday afternoon at the Remount Veternary Corps Centre and was later moved to his house in Shradhapuri Colony in Kankerkhera region. Hundreds of people spilled onto streets to pay floral homage to Sharma, 32, who was killed in an encounter with militants in Anantnag district of Jammu and Kashmir on Monday morning. A militant was also killed while three Army personnel, including another Major, were injured. The officer's 4-year-old daughtersalutes him one last timeThe slain officer’s body was taken to Surajkund cremation centre in an Army truck amid patriotic slogans raised by the crowds thronging both sides of the road. Sharma’s mortal remains were consigned to flames in the presence of MP Rajinder Agarwal, UP cane minister Suresh Rana and senior administrative officials, including the DM and SSP, apart from Army personnel. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath has announced an ex gratia of Rs 25 lakh for the kin of the Major and a government job for a family member. A road will also be named in his memory. “Government must do something that no other mother loses her son this way,” an inconsolable Usha Sharma, deceased officer's mother, was heard telling senior Army officers who visited the family. Sharma was posted at 19 Rashtriya Rifles. He was inducted into the Army in December 2012. Sharma is survived by a four-year-old daughter, Kiara, and widow, Ira Sharma. According to the family, he had come home on leave and had left for J&K on May 27 to join his unit. The encounter took place in the Achabal area of South Kashmir's Anantnag district. The injured were rushed to the 92 base hospital of the Army in Srinagar, officials said. The attack on the Major’s team took place almost a week after five CRPF personnel were killed near the same spot in Anantnag district. One of the personnel was from neighbouring Shamli district. Now, 400 cartons of seized liquor goes m.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: In a big embarrassment, over 400 cartons of liquor which was seized in raids in the last few years went missing from the store room of Titawi Police station in Muzaffarnagar. An FIR was later filed against storeroom in-charge of Titawi Police station. An inquiry was also set up to look into the theft. In-charge of the storeroom, Jagbeer Singh was booked under section 409 (Criminal breach of trust by a public servant,) of IPC after a probe was conducted by deputy superintendent of police, Fugana. The discrepancy came into light after an audit was conducted by a police officer. According to station house officer of Titavi police station, Kshit Kumar said, “FIR has been registered against in-charge of the storeroom and a high-level probe was ordered into the matter.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

26 hurt in accident as bus driver \u2018.description: BIJNOR: As many as 26 people, including the driver and conductor, of a Haryana Roadways bus were injured when a truck hit it from the rear. The bus was on way to Lakhimpur Kheri in UP from Hisar in Haryana when the accident took place near Gajraula, on the Lucknow-Delhi national highway, at about 4.30 am on Tuesday. Passengers blamed the bus driver for the accident. “He had dozed off and that led to the accident in which a truck hit the bus from the rear,” said one of them. After the accident, the truck driver fled. The injured were admitted to a nearby hospital. There were 54 passengers in the bus. After learning about the accident at Gajraula in Amroha district, local police rushed to the spot and took the injured passengers to a nearby hospital for treatment. All were out of danger. Talking with TOI, Gajraula station house officer Neeraj Kumar, “The injured were treated in a nearby hospital. Later, they left for their destination. Police are trying to track the truck driver who fled with the vehicle after the accident, A case is being registered against unidentified truck driver.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

650 transformers \u2018blow off\u2019 th.description: BIJNOR: Around 25 transformers in western UP’s Bijnor district are ‘blowing off’ every day due to huge power overload this summer. And the constant malfunctioning of transformers is leading to massive power outages in the district causing much inconvenience to the people in this scorching heat. Power department officials claimed that on an average 10-12 transformers ‘blow off’ in other seasons. But, the count nearly doubled this summer with around 650 transformers stopped functioning between May 14 and June 14, the officials admitted. And as a result, with regular power cuts, the people – battling the severe heat wave - are living in hellish conditions. Some of the transformers have been badly damaged during the ongoing heat wave. It was 46 degrees Celsius recorded in Bijnor on Saturday. So, it is problem aplenty for Paschimanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam Limited. According to sources, there is a provision that burnt transformers should be replaced within 24 hours in a city and 72 hours in rural areas. But here, the power corporation has failed to replace the transformers on time. Assistant engineer at a workshop, Susheel Kumar, said, “With rising temperature, cases of burning transformers have doubled. Earlier, under normal situation, around 10 to 12 transformers were burning out in a day while at present, the numbers have reached 22 to 25 per day. Most of the burning transformers are of ‘25KVA’.” Kumar also said, “In summer, both power consumption and load usually shoots up resulting in damaging the transformer. There are over 70,000 tubewells in the district which almost runs every day to irrigate the crop. Here, the main crop is sugarcane which requires more irrigation than others. Besides, AC, fans and coolers are used in excess. We are trying our best to replace the burnt transformers.” The transformers which ‘blow off’ also pose a threat to the people, particularly in populated areas. Arbaaz Khan, a resident of Sherkot, said, “Blowing off transformers is common for villagers in summer season. But, the situation is very bad this year. On Friday, a transformer in Halwaeyaan Mohalla of Sherkot suddenly caught fire. There was panic all around but luckily no one was hurt. Power corporation authorities should do regular inspections of the transformers - maintain it properly and check its load from time to time.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Meerut: One killed in firing at panchaya.description: MEERUT: One person was killed and three injured in firing at a panchayat in a Baghpat village held to settle a marital discord late on Sunday evening. The incident took place at Soop village in Ramala region of the district. After the panchayat broke into a verbal war, four people were shot at. One of them died on the spot while three were admitted to a local hospital. According to police sources, Sonia, a resident of Kapurgarh village of Muzaffarnagar was married to Bhupender Singh of Soop village ten years ago. The couple has three kids. They had strained marital ties and several panchayats had been held in the past to resolve the matter. In one such effort on Sunday, Sonia’s relatives -- including brothers Bhagat Singh, Ajit Singh and other relatives -- reached Soop village to take Sonia back home for which a panchayat was held. The panchayat ruled that Sonia's kin could take her to Muzaffarnagar on Monday. However, her brothers wanted to take her on Sunday itself which led to a heated argument between two groups. “Both the families and their associates had met in village Soop to settle the matter on Sunday evening. However, during heated arguments between the two groups, someone fired shots that hit four elders. Out of them one Mohkam Singh, 55, died on the spot. The other three are admitted to a local hospital and currently out of danger. Investigations are on and we are trying to figure out how it all began,” said additional SP Ranvijay Singh. Police sources reveal that out of four persons who were hit three -- including Mohkam who died -- belonged to Bhupender’s group. The one injured from Sonia’s side was Bhagat Singh. “We all were trying to convince panchayat elders to allow us to take Sonia on Sunday night itself but they became adamant and at that time only shots were fired. We were targeted by Sonia’s in-laws. I was hit in the back.” Baghpat SP Shailesh Kumar Pandey said: “We have detained five members from Sonia’s family, including Sonia herself, and are questioning them. The two other injured Sudhir and Raju are out of danger.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

College manager found murdered in house.description: BIJNOR: A 35-year-old manager of a city college was found murdered at his house in Amroha city’s Khatriyan Mohalla. Police claimed that the deceased, Ayush Tandon, was attacked by robbers late on Tuesday night. The incident came to fore when a lineman called by the victim reached the house late night and found the body with slit throat. There were many injuries on the body. The deceased was also a prominent businessman. Police officials, including additional superintendent of police Brajesh Singh and circle officer Jitendra Kumar, reached the spot and inspected the house where the body was found. Police have recovered a knife from the crime scene. The body has been sent to district hospital for post mortem. Amroha station house officer Sateesh Kumar said, “Ayush Tandon lived alone in his house after his wife moved to her house around one year ago.” A case against unidentified killers has been registered and probe is on. According to sources, illicit relationship might be one of reasons behind the murder. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

1,200 IMA doctors, 272 hosps and nursing.description: MEERUT: At least 1,200 doctors under the banner of Indian Medical Association and 272 nursing homes remained on strike on Monday as a sign of protest against the attack on the doctor in Kolkata and demanded safer work conditions. While emergency units remained open, all other health services were put on hold on Monday. The government hospitals in the district remained on its toes to offer health services to patients. Meanwhile, the doctors in government hospitals wore bandages on their head as a sign to show that they can be attacked any time and will need first aid. “As many as 1,200 doctors in Meerut remained on a 24-hour strike starting Monday morning at 6am. While the out-patient department services remained closed throughout the day, the emergency services were open so that patients can be catered to,” said Dr Shishir Jain, president, Indian Medical Association, Meerut unit. The closed out patient department made it difficult for the patients who came from different parts of the district as they were turned away and not attended to. Meanwhile, the district hospital and Lala Lajpat Rai Memorial (LLRM) Medical college faced a huge increase in the number of patients. Dr Dinesh Rana, deputy to superintendent in chief, LLRM Medical College, said, “The number of patients in OPD increased considerably on Monday. Comparing it with the previous working day which was Saturday, the number shot up considerably. The number of OPD patients on Saturday was 3214, which rose to 4453 on Monday.” The protests came in the backdrop of the incident in which a doctor called Paribaha Mukharjee from Kolkata's NRS Medical College was brutally attacked by a mob of 200 people after a 75-year-old patient died of cardiac arrest. The incident raised concerns regarding security of doctors. The week-long junior doctors' strike across state-run hospitals in West Bengal was called off on Monday following a meeting between Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and representatives of the agitating medics. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

As 90% hand pumps dry up, 15 Bijnor vill.description: BIJNOR: People living in as many as 15 villages in Bijnor have been facing a water crisis due to a dip in groundwater by three metres for long. The problem has become acute this summer with 90% of the government hand pumps in the area drying up. Now, villagers are forced to fetch water from far off places. For the residents of these villages located in Najibabad, Afjalgarh and Kotwali Dehat development blocks, they can only look up at the sky praying to the rain god to shower them with rainfall during the coming monsoon as their repeated pleas for resolving their water scarcity problem to the authorities have fallen on deaf ears. The water scarcity problem has been looming large over the 15 villages including Jalalpur, Nakipur, Bharatpur Mitho, Kayam Nagar, Tanda Sahuwala, Harvanshwala, Sikkawala, Garhi, Sardarpur Chhaeli, Shiriya and Chak and Rampur. Talking with TOI, village head of Shiriya, Birmo Devi, said, “It is a long-standing problem. Every summer, villagers face drinking water crisis. Now, private hand pumps have dried up while government’s India Marka hand pumps have also stopped lifting water. A few that work are spewing dirty water. I have prepared a project to install around six deep-bore hand pumps at the village. The project is in the pipeline.” Hukum Singh, a villager of Jalalpur, said, “There are over 25 India Marka hand pumps at my village. But only three of them are working. Every day, from early morning, villagers, especially women, queue up to draw water. We have been demanding for years that water be supplied through pipeline but no action has been taken in this regard.” Villagers told TOI that water scarcity has affected farmers who are unable to irrigate their crops. The area faces shortage of water despite the fact that as many as seven rivers, including the Ganga, flow through the district. Experts attribute the water woes of the region to over-exploitation of groundwater. When TOI contacted the executive engineer of Jal Nigam, Bharat Singh, he said, “I am aware about the problems faced by the residents of these villages. In summer, groundwater level there dips by three meters. We can install only those hand pumps that can draw water from a depth of 30 to 50 metres. Given the terrain, it is not possible to bore deeper. Only piped water supply scheme can resolve the crisis. We are making a plan for the same.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

After leopard kills colt, angry villager.description: BIJNOR: Residents of Bijnor’s Naiwala village held forest officials hostage on Sunday, demanding security for themselves and their livestock after a leopard killed and partially devoured a colt there. For some time, a stray leopard has been prowling around in the area, posing a threat to several villages but forest department authorities has made no efforts to catch it, they claimed. The villagers said they could not go on living in constant fear while forest department did nothing to protect them. According to villagers, on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, a leopard entered human inhabited area and killed a colt tied up for the night in a shed on the fringes of Naiwala village under Heempur police station area. On Sunday, its owner discovered the carcass and informed police. According to the Liyaqat Ali, “I have some horses, including a colt. They were tied in the yard on the outskirts of the village. I found its partially devoured carcass on Sunday. Earlier. I had spotted a leopard in the area.” As news spread, angry villagers gathered at the spot. They staged a protest against forest department and alleged that they had informed the forest authorities about the presence of a leopard in the area but they did nothing to catch it. After being informed about the colt’s killing, a forest team reached the spot. But enraged villagers took them hostage and held them captive for hours. They demanded that the leopard be caught and released into the forest area. In summer, most villagers sleep in the open and with a leopard prowling about, the situation can prove to be dangerous, especially as these leopards are known to lift children. The forest authorities were set free only after they assured the villagers that they would set up a cage in the area to catch the leopard. Confirming that the colt was killed by the leopard, Bijnor divisional forest officer M Semmaran said, “The colt’s post-mortem revealed that it was eaten by a leopard. There is a provision that if we set up a cage, we have to take permission from the higher authorities. The procedure is underway and cage will be set up soon. We have convinced villagers that it will not attack the human being. But they should take precautions. When a leopard does not get its natural prey, it moves towards populated area in search of small prey like dogs, goats, calves, colts, sheep and poultry.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Four killed as tractor-trailer overturns.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Four labourers were killed when a tractor-trailer carrying bricks overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut on Tuesday, police said.  The deceased, identified as Nazim (28), Kamil (32), Rizwan (30) and Kamil (34), belonged to Jolla village in Muzaffarnagar, police added.  The bodies have been sent for a post-mortem examination. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In UP, woman throws hot oil on ex-lover.description: MEERUT: In a case of relationship gone horribly wrong, a 20-year-old woman threw hot mustard oil on a 22-year-old, just hours before the latter’s wedding day. The woman is a resident of Mazargate in Bulandshahr’s Anoopshahr area while the 22-year-old has been identified as Umesh Joshi. The bizarre incident took place on Sunday morning, hours before Joshi’s wedding. Joshi has sustained burn injuries on his face. According to police, the accused, who is now under arrest, confessed to have committed the crime after she learnt about her lover’s wedding with some other person. The woman sneaked into Joshi’s house at around 4 am and caught him off-guard. Joshi was fast asleep and couldn’t thwart her move. The accused has been arrested now, the police said. Basanti, the victim’s mother, claimed that the accused woman wanted to disrupt the wedding after he failed to “force her way in marrying the victim”. Joshi was discharged after given primary aid at a local hospital. He has sustained burn injuries on his face, but is currently stable. Sources claim that the marriage will continue as scheduled. Initially, a case of acid attack under section 326 A (voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid) of the Indian Penal Code was registered at Anoopshahr police station. But later, the police stated that they would take remand under section 327. “The accused is under arrest. During investigation, it was established that the substance was hot mustard oil and not acid. Hence, the police will take remand under section 327 (voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapon/means),” said Atul Kumar Chaubey, Annopshahr CO. Read this story in BengaliDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Goat beaten up mercilessly by neighbour,.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: A woman and her minor son reached a police station in Muzaffarnagar on Thursday morning with an unusual complaint. They wanted a case to be registered against the neighbour who beat up their goat so badly that it went blind. Shahnaz Begum, a resident of Didahedi village under the jurisdiction of Nagar-Kotali, asked the police to register a case and arrest the attacker. In her complaint she alleged that her goat had gone to her neigbour’s terrace and there someone attacked her with an intention to kill her. She took her goat to district animal hospital for treatment. Veterinary doctor Raj Kumar said, "It seems the goat was beaten up by a sharp object. The goat’s eye is completely damaged.” Station house officer of Nagar-Kotwali Anil Kapwan said,"It comes under animal cruelty act. We are investigating the matter. A case will be registered accordingly after the investigation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

61 districts fail to provide details of.description: MEERUT: The mid-day meal officials pulled up district authorities after 61 districts failed to feed contact numbers of the mothers of ‘Maa Samooh’, which keeps a check on the food being served in each district. The authorities have now been asked to complete the task on priority. “This is to bring to your notice that to check the quality of food being served as mid-day meal Maa Samoohs (groups of mothers) are there for each school. Each school has their contact number and details. But since the state authorities don’t have the contacts, all the districts were asked to provide the contacts on the online portal of the education department,” stated Abdul Samad, director, mid-day meal in an official letter. However, a recent analysis of the uploaded data found that out of the total 75 districts in UP, 61 districts are yet to provide the details. “Only 14 districts, including Shamli, Hapur, Pratapgarh, Etah, Unnao and others, have submitted the details. Others are yet to send the details. All the districts are instructed to send the contacts on priority,” read Samad’s order. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Slain Major Ketan Sharma\u2019s wife sti.description: MEERUT: At the house of Major Ketan Sharma – who was killed in an encounter with militants in Anantnag district of Jammu and Kashmir – in Shradhapuri, there is shock, disbelief and mourning. His wife and mother refuse to eat, and his four-year-old daughter Kiara waits for her father so that she can salute him one more time – just like she did at the crematorium on Tuesday. “Ketan was supposed to call me after returning safely from the cross-firing. In the last conversation I had with him via SMSes, I asked him if he was ok, and he told me how his colleague had got shot in the stomach. ‘Vaapas akar call karna’ (call me when you return), I texted him. He is yet to reply to my message and yet to call me,” said Era Sharma, his wife. “Ketan would often joke that if he dies, the first call I will get will be from the commanding officer. That day when the CO called, it was as if my ears had refused to hear what he was saying. I kept asking the CO if he was safe, but he didn’t say anything,” said Era. Seven years ago, when he was commissioned as an officer in the passing-out parade, there were celebrations at their house. It was his sheer determination that got him entry into the Army. In fact, the family sources revealed even at the age of eight, Ketan used to be fascinated by the sheer sight of Army boots. According to Major Ketan’s aunt Sunita Sharma, “Ketan made three unsuccessful attempts for National Defence Academy (NDA) and later three attempts he made for Combined Defence Services (CDS) but failed to clear the interview.” “After all, it was in his seventh and last attempt that he had made it. We distributed sweets and there was cheer all around because everybody was so happy about his dream getting fulfilled. But who knew all those celebrations were for this fateful day when he returned wrapped in the Tricolour?” said Sunita Sharma. Major Ketan’s four-year-old daughter Kiara is too young to realise what has happened to her father. A moving picture of her saluting her father at the crematorium with a smile on her face that was published in this newspaper on Wednesday brought tears to the eyes of all present at the funeral. Kiara’s maternal uncle Sachin said, “She is too young. We are collecting newspaper clippings to show her later when she grows up what great sacrifice her father had made.” The little girl doesn’t stop asking questions about her dad unless she is told he will return soon with a toy for her. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman commits suicide over dispute with.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: A 30-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide along with her 7-year-old-daughter by consuming poison in Mansoorpur area. According to the police, the women took the extreme step after an altercation with her husband. According to police, the woman died on way to hospital while the girl died during treatment. The incident took place in Nara village. According to police sources, Minu Sharma consumed poison and gave the same to her daughter Khushi after she reportedly had a minor tiff with her husband Sunil Sharma. Sunil Sharma, husband of deceased, told TOI,"I found that some money was missing from my wallet. While inquiring about it, she and I fought after which I left the house. When I came back, I was informed by my neighbours that my wife and daughter committed suicide. Never would I have imagined that a such small tiff between us can lead to my wife and daughter’s death.” Meanwhile, Minu Sharma’s parents approached the police and have filed a complaint against Sunil Sharma, blaming him for their daughter’s death. Superintendent of police of Muzaffarnagar city, Satpal Antil said, “We have sent the bodies for post-mortem examination. Minu Sharma’s parents have filed a complaint against Sunil. We have ordered probe.” SHO of Mansoorpur police station, Sanjeev Kumar said, “We are waiting for the postmortem report following which appropriate action will be taken.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Journalist assaulted by cops: Two-member.description: MEERUT: Days after a Shamli-based journalist Amit Sharma was assaulted by cops at GRP station, a two-member team of Press Council of India (PCI) comprising Jai Shankar Gupta and Uttam Chand Sharma reached Shamli on Saturday morning. The team held a closed door meeting with local journalists at a city hotel. It also recorded the victim’s statement and of other journalists who were present at the spot when the incident took place. The team visited the local GRP station as well. This comes a day after NHRC issued a notice to UP DGP OP Singh calling for a detailed report in the matter, including action taken against the guilty public servants and status of the FIR registered against them. “Going by the reported allegations, this kind of cruel and uncivilised act by a public servant is highly disgraceful and cannot be tolerated in a civilised society,” the human rights body stated in a release. “Stern action should be taken against the police personnel if found guilty so that such a barbaric act is not repeated by any public servant in future,” the release added. A case against four police personnel, including SHO Rakesh Kumar under the IPC sections 323 (causing hurt), 504 (intentional insult), 506 (criminal intimidation), 364 (abduction), 392 (punishment for robbery) and 342 (wrongful confinement) has been lodged at GRP police station after the assault. Out of the four accused, SHO Kumar and another constable were suspended soon after the incident. It all began on Tuesday evening when GRP personnel entered into an argument with Sharma when the latter was covering the derailment of a goods train in Shamli. Several videos of the attack went viral after the incident in which SHO Kumar could be seen attacking Sharma near the derailment site at Dhimanpur area of the district. The victim also claimed he was stripped by cops and Kumar urinated in his mouth. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

House crumbles in Muzaffarnagar, 6-year-.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: About 12 members of a family had a miraculous escape when their duplex house caved in on Tuesday morning. However, a six-year-old boy died in the incident that happened in village Hind of Thanabhawan town of Shamli district. According to police sources, Gayyur Ahmad along with his six brothers and their families stayed in a duplex house. On Tuesday morning, suddenly the roof of the upper story began crumbling leading to panic and more than 20 members of the family ran outside the house shouting for help. Six others were buried while escaping but locals rushed in for help and saved five members. Later, during the rescue operation conducted by the police, Faizan's body was recovered from the rubbles. All injured are being treated at district hospital. Deputy Superintendent of police, Surender Yadav said," Primary investigation has revealed that due to cracking of house's main beam, the building had collapsed. A further investigation is on into the matter.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Station officer\u2019s heroic effort sav.description: MEERUT: Repairing an old well, a labourer was buried alive after a huge chunk of loose earth fell on him. The rescue operation involving an earth removing machine took more than eight hours to bring out the injured labourer. And it was all possible mainly due to a heroic effort of a station officer. Manveer, the labourer, was admitted to a hospital in a critical state. He is now out of danger. In a video that has gone viral, station officer of Khanpur police station Jagdeep Malik is seen inside the well trying to rescue the semi-conscious labourer despite the walls of the well caving in and repeatedly hampering the rescue effort. The incident occurred in Isanpur village of Khanpur region of Bulandshahr on Wednesday where Brahmpal Singh had deployed three labourers to extract bricks from a well’s lining. “While extracting the bricks, loose mud began to fall into the well. Two labourers came out in time, but the third one, Manveer, couldn’t make it,” Malik said. “Soon, the police were informed and force from several police stations rushed to the spot. So did the villagers. An earth moving machine was pressed into the rescue operation, but it proved of little help,” he added. According to Malik, the well’s wall was repeatedly caving in while the earth-moving machine was in operation and we were losing crucial time. “It was then I along with another villager entered and stopped the excavation part and used shovels gently to dig out mud. All this was happening at 25 feet below the surface. Manveer was found after five feet of digging. Fortunately, the brick lining that fell along the mud gave him a little space to breathe,” he said. 25-year-old beaten to death for harassin.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: A 25-year-old man was beaten to death for allegedly harassing a woman in Muzaffarnagar’s Khedi Sudiyaan village on Monday night. The deceased was allegedly beaten to death by relatives of the woman. Police force has been deployed to avoid any untoward incident in the area. Meanwhile, police are also probing an angle of dispute over money in the case. The deceased has been identified as Shekhar, 25. He was a resident of the village Sisoli. A case of murder has been registered and an accused has also been arrested so far, said Bachchan Singh Atri, station house officer of Bhora Kalan police station. He said, “We have arrested a man, Sudeep, after a case was filed by the deceased's family against five persons.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Six minor girls raped in last seven days.description: BIJNOR: There has been a spate of rapes of minor girls in Bijnor with as many as six such cases reported in the district in the past seven days. The latest one was reported on Sunday evening where a seven-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her neighbour in Bijnor’s Kiratpur area. The accused has been arrested. In the other rape cases, the minors were aged between seven and 16 years. FIRs have been lodged. The latest crime was reported at Jataan Mohalla of Kiratpur town on Sunday evening and the accused was arrested on Monday. According to police, 21-year-old neighbour, Aaseef, lured the girl and took her to his house, raped her and then fled. The girl’s family and other neighbours came to her rescue. Locals and the girl’s family informed the police and took her to a private hospital. She is stated to be out of danger. The police have registered a case under section 376 of IPC and POCSO Act. Aaseef has been arrested. Addressing a press conference, superintendent of police, Sanjeev Tyagi, claimed that police have taken cognizance of the crime, arrested the accused and sent him to prison. In other recent rape cases, a 15-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her friend’s 22-year-old brother at her friend’s house on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. The minor’s family has alleged that the girl’s 19-year-old friend had taken the girl to her house at Paadali Mandu village under Dhampur police station area. The girl remained missing from her house on Saturday night and narrated her ordeal to the family on Sunday. In another case, a 16-year-old girl in Dhampur area accused a 22-year-old neighbour of raping her following which a case was registered. Police arrested the accused and sent him to jail. It took place at Nai Saray Mohalla of Bijnor’s Dhampur. On June 13, two minors - aged seven and eight - were raped in two separate rape cases under Barhapur police station in Bijnor. The police registered the two cases and made arrests. The crime was committed in Sikkawala and Ismaelpur villages. One girl was asleep while the other was going to a wedding. In yet another case, a 16-year-old girl was raped after Saddam allegedly entered her house and raped her at Meerapur Mohli in Bijnor’s Afzalgarh area on June 12. An FIR was filed and the police have booked Saddam. Dr Beena Singh, a social worker, told TOI, “Minor girls are soft targets for rapists. They cannot resist the advances of these men. Parents should be more careful and keep a watch on their girls’ whereabouts. And they should not leave their daughter alone. They should always interact with their children. Also, prompt and strict action should be taken in such crimes by police and court.” Bijnor superintendent of police, Sanjeev Tyagi, assured, “The police are taking strict and prompt action against the accused. Parents should also maintain a close watch on their girls.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded.
